instruction: What kinds of spectral indices were used to predict oil palm yield in oil palm discrimination?
Output: The related study used remote sensing spectrum to predict oil palm yield in oil palm discrimination.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to predict oil palm yield in oil palm discrimination?
Output: Feature selection algorithm with linear projection was applied to select the best combination of spectral indices in oil palm classification.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance to predict oil palm yield in oil palm discriminations?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the prediction models to predict oil palm yield in oil palm discrimination was the Root Mean Square Error (RMSE), Mean Squared Error (MSE), and Mean Absolute Error (MAE).

instruction: What machine learning algorithms were used to predict oil palm yield in oil palm discrimination that proposed a new approach to predict oil palm yield using multi-temporal remote sensing data and ensemble machine learning algorithms?
Output: The machine learning algorithms used to predict oil palm yield in oil palm discrimination were ReliefF algorithm with linear projection, random forest (RF), and modified AdaBoost.

instruction: Can the proposed approach of predicting oil palm yield using multi-temporal remote sensing data and ensemble machine learning algorithms be applied to other crops or agricultural practices?
Output: Yes, the proposed approach of predicting crop yield using multi-temporal remote sensing data and ensemble machine learning algorithms can be applied to other crops or agricultural practices.
